artist: Artist: Unknown Italian (Lombardy?), 17th century; Artist: Circle of Pellegrino Tibaldi
description: Pluto driving an open chariot pulled by four horses, holding the gesturing Persephone by the waist; running figure in front of horses; two putti fly over chariot; verso not examined (received framed)
markings: LLC, stamped in blue: [GV] Lugt 1223; LRC, stamped in red: [Carlo Prayer] Lugt 2044
medium: Pen and brown ink and black and white chalk on gray-blue laid paper
provenance: Giuseppe Vallardi, Lugt 1223 (1784-1863), Milan. Captain Carlo Prayer, Lugt 2044 (1826-1900), Milan. Benno Geiger, Vienna (until 1920; his sale, Sotheby's, London, December 7-10, 1920, no. 84 as by G. B. Crespi). Edward Lucie-Smith (b.1933), United Kingdom. Sale, Sotheby's, London, November 19, 1963, no. 53, as by Domenico Canuti. [Alfred Brod Gallery, London, in 1964]; Carl Robert Rudolf, Lugt 2811b, London (until 1977; his sale, Sotheby's, London, May 19, 1977, no. 70 as Emilian school for Â£240, to Moir); Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1977-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Pluto Abducting Persephone (recto); Figural Studies (verso)
